title: Picking the Perfect Headshot for Your Resume
summary: This video provides expert advice on creating a professional headshot to enhance job applications and online profiles. It covers the importance of a photo, posing techniques like 'The Squinch', and tips on attire and background selection.

steps.action: Treat your headshot as a 'virtual handshake' and your opening salvo to recruiters.
Focus on 'lookability'—the image's ability to secure attention and stop the scroll on social feeds.
Look directly at the camera and smile to cultivate an approachable online brand.
Utilize 'The Squinch' technique by narrowing the distance between the lower eyelid and the pupil to convey confidence.
Dress for the job you want, not the job you have. Include props or attire relevant to the profession (e.g., a stethoscope for medical roles).
Avoid busy backgrounds to ensure you are the main focus of the image.

key_takeaways: LinkedIn profiles with headshots receive 21x more views.
A good headshot should capture your essence and stop a recruiter from scrolling past.
Visual cues in clothing can help recruiters visualize you in the role.
